# Series Overview

Welcome to my comprehensive Data Science Steps series! This series is designed to take you through the entire data science workflow, from initial data exploration to advanced modeling techniques.

## What You'll Learn

::: {.callout-tip}
## Key Learning Outcomes
By following this series, you'll learn:
- How to effectively explore and understand data
- Techniques for feature preprocessing and generation
- Methods for handling different types of data
- Best practices in data science workflows
:::

## Series Contents

### [Part 1: EDA Fundamentals](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part01)
- Understanding the importance of EDA
- Visualization techniques
- Building domain knowledge
- Data validation approaches

### [Part 2: Feature Preprocessing and Generation](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part02)
- Data cleaning techniques
- Feature engineering fundamentals
- Handling missing values
- Scaling and normalization

### [Part 3: Handling Anonymized Data](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part03)
- Working with masked data
- Pattern recognition in anonymous features
- Statistical analysis techniques
- Feature importance in anonymous datasets

### [Part 4: Text Feature Extraction](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part04)
- Text preprocessing
- NLP techniques
- Word embeddings
- Text vectorization methods

### [Part 5: Image Feature Extraction](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part05)
- Image preprocessing
- Feature extraction techniques
- Computer vision basics
- Deep learning approaches

### [Part 6: Advanced Techniques](/posts/data-science-steps-to-follow-part06)
- Advanced modeling strategies
- Ensemble methods
- Model optimization
- Production deployment considerations

## Prerequisites

To get the most out of this series, you should have:
- Basic Python programming knowledge
- Understanding of basic statistics
- Familiarity with pandas and numpy
- Basic machine learning concepts
